intro: Pyrrhocactus marksianus var. tunensis, commonly known as the Tunisian pyrrhocactus, is a succulent plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems and spiny, leaf-like structures. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months, adding ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in arid climates.
